snippet: Genetic testing of embryos raises unsettling ethical questions that trouble advocates for the disabled and have left some doctors struggling with what they should tell their patients.
abstract: Preimplantation diagnosis, genetic testing of embryos, has soared as methods have improved and more disease-causing genes have been discovered; its use, which makes it possible for couples to ensure their children will not inherit faulty gene, does raise unsettling ethical questions that trouble advocates for the disabled and have left some doctors struggling with what they should tell their patients.
